layoutObject.title: New! Mobile MyUW
layoutObject.description: Information about the new mobile view of MyUW
layoutObject.staticContent:
MyUW is now more mobile friendly!

Desktop vs. Mobile

  • Most, but not all, content is available in the mobile view. Learn more.
  • Can't locate something in the mobile view? Use the "Switch to Full Site" link at the bottom of any page.
  • Want to check out the mobile version from your desktop? Use the "Switch to Mobile Site" link at the bottom of any page.

Share Your Feedback

In the coming months, we'll continue to roll out enhancements but we want to hear from you!  Send us your ideas, feedback and questions.

layoutObject.title: GLACIER Nonresident Tax Preparation
layoutObject.description: If you are a nonresident alien UW employee, use this application to create a GLACIER account and gain access to a tax preparation program to assist you in preparing a Nonresident Alien Income Tax Return.
layoutObject.staticContent:
Glacier Tax Prep (GTP) is interactive software designed to help nonresident aliens (for tax purposes) prepare a U.S. Nonresident Alien Income Tax Return (Form 1040NR or 1040NR-EZ).

UW-affiliated individuals who received U.S. sourced income during the prior calendar year may use GTP to prepare the corresponding yearâ€™s tax return and/or Form 8843. Access may be gained free of charge through the welcome menu in an individualâ€™s UW Payroll-issued Glacier account (https://www.online-tax.net/). The GTP option will be selectable from early March until June (tax filing deadline is April 15th) only if the individual was a nonresident alien for tax purposes during the relevant calendar year.

Further details are available at: https://uwservice.wisc.edu/tax/filing-resources.php. UW employees and students who do not have a Glacier account may request GTP access: https://uwservice.wisc.edu/docs/publications/tax-nonresident-alien-resources.pdf.

portlets.title: GLACIER Nonresident Tax Preparation
portlets.description: If you are a nonresident alien UW employee, use this application to create a GLACIER account and gain access to a tax preparation program to assist you in preparing a Nonresident Alien Income Tax Return.
portlets.name: GLACIER Nonresident Tax Preparation

layoutObject.title: Important Announcement
layoutObject.description: Provides an important message for the Work Record tab
layoutObject.staticContent: NOTICE:  We've made a few changes to how we show your course information in MyUW.  The Course Resources app has been replaced by the new mobile friendly My Courses app on the Learning tab.  In the new My Courses app, you will continue to have access to your Library Reserves, Learn@UW, Moodle, course web sites, and Textbooks.  Additionally, you can now see your Course Schedule at-a-glance.

layoutObject.title: WAA Membership
layoutObject.description: The Wisconsin Alumni Association offers special rates for new graduates.
layoutObject.staticContent:
A Special Offer for New Graduates

Congratulations on your recent graduation! To send you off into the "real world" with everything you need to remain a full-fledged Badger, the Wisconsin Alumni Association (WAA) would like to offer you a special new grad package that includes five years of WAA membership for the price of 4!


For only $100, enjoy being a WAA member for five years - saving you a total of $25 off our already discounted recent grad rates.


Sign up for your special new grad offer!
layoutObject.pithyStaticContent: Sign up for your special new grad offer!

portlets.title: WAA Membership
portlets.description: The Wisconsin Alumni Association offers special rates for new graduates.
portlets.name: WAA Membership

layoutObject.title: CareerLocker
layoutObject.description: Career development resource that includes helpful career information, exploration and planning tools, resume and cover letter programs, and an ePortfolio.
layoutObject.staticContent:
Explore this comprehensive, easy-to-use career information website.

What are your plans after graduation?
As a UW student, you can use a valuable resource developed at the UW, CareerLocker, to:
  • Research more than 700 occupations and 450 specializations with information on salary, job outlook, and job openings
  • Search 6000 colleges and universities by major and program of study
  • Take career assessments and match results to careers that may fit your interests, skills, and values
  • Create an ePortfolio to provide evidence of your potential to employers
CareerLocker is developed by:

portlets.title: CareerLocker
portlets.description: Career development resource that includes helpful career information, exploration and planning tools, resume and cover letter programs, and an ePortfolio.
portlets.name: CareerLocker

The HRS Self Service links are now available below in the Time and Absence portlet and Manager Time and Approval portlet.
